review_title: Went from Good to Bad in 2 years
pros: The philosophy and mission statement are right on and I supported that message. They have good  intentions in place if put into effect would make a dynamic company.
cons: Management heavy, at one point there were seven managers that had some say in how our job should function. The recent placement of a Quality Assurance program put too much emphasis on "selling hospice", scripting phone call responses and took away the human touch. Being short staffed stressed out the employees and they ended up turning on one another with petty undermining actions. We went from working one weekend every five weeks to working every other weekend and 3 holidays out of six was just too much. People had warned me about the instability of management and that things are constantly changing from one extreme to another, then I experienced it first hand.

review_title: Enjoyed my work but did not enjoy how management did not promote employee advancement.
pros: No on-call hours for aides, Monday through Friday work week, exceptional aides and volunteers working together, in-services conducted online.
cons: Direct management not supportive of lower employees trying to advance out of the field and into the office setting.  Extensive travel during terrible weather conditions due to regional territories branching out and the organization not hiring persons who reside in the new areas.
